document.docAuthor: Haddad, Charles R., Lyle, Robin, Bosselaers, Jan & Ramirez, Martin J.
document.docTitle: Austrachelas reavelli Haddad, Lyle, Bosselaers & Ramirez, 2009, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the endemic South African spider genus Austrachelas, with its transfer to the Gallieniellidae (Arachnida: Araneae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the endemic South African spider genus Austrachelas, with its transfer to the Gallieniellidae (Arachnida: Araneae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology . The species epithet is a patronym in honour of Peter Reavell, who collected the holotype , in recognition of the large quantity of valuable spider material that he has collected in South Africa , particularly from KwaZulu-Natal.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 68–75. Genitalic morphology of

species. (68–71)
A. pondoensis
n. sp.
: female epigyne, ventral view (68), dorsal view (69), male palp, ventral view (70), retrolateral view (71); (72–75)
A. reavelli
n. sp.
: female epigyne, ventral view (72), dorsal view (73), male palp, ventral view (74), retrolateral view (75). Scale bars = 0.1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Male . Measurements: CL 2.33 , CW 1.72 , FL 0.22 , AL 2.23 , AW 1.25 , SL 1.38 , SW 0.95 , TL 4.70 , AME–AME 0.05 , AME–ALE 0.03 , ALE–ALE 0.23 , PME–PME 0.04 , PME–PLE 0.07 , PLE–PLE 0.34 .
